statement_text: But there have still been 8.1 million birds killed this year to help control the spread of the disease and 5.8 million of those have come just this month as several large egg farms have been struck. That [5.8 million birds killed this month] includes 1.2 million birds at one Iowa egg farm and another 940,000 chickens at one Minnesota egg farm that had to be killed.

rationale: The segment uses neutral language ('have still been... killed', 'have come', 'had to be killed') without high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.

That [5.8 million birds killed this month] includes 1.2 million birds at one Iowa egg farm and another 940,000 chickens at one Minnesota egg farm that had to be killed.

rationale: Contains scale ('8.1 million birds', '5.8 million', '1.2 million', '940,000') and a moderate verb ('struck'), but the scale is linked to 'killed' (containment verb), which neutralises the pattern.
